channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pole has been knocked over leaving stub, 24th June
item.description:
Trip hazard - I caught my foot as walking along. Base of pole Needs to be removed

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household items outside of block, 24th June
item.description:
These items have been here since last week and it looks like people have begun smashing the items across the floor making it dangerous for other residents.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Leatherhead Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water coming from back of shop, 24th June
item.description:
Water is coming from the back of this shops aircon or ventilation system, the water sheds across the footpath which seems to encourage algae, and then flows into the gutter. Other than being very unpleasant this presents a hazard for pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dalton Street, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping Pellerin Rd, 24th June
item.description:
Hello Hackney We need your help in collecting this fly tipping waste. It arrived last week and was dumped on the road. For safety, I moved it from off the road and onto the pavement and into my neighbourâ€™s front garden.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti along the fences and walls of the alleyway, 24th June
item.description:
The brick walls and fence have been graffitied on and then painted over with brown paint to cover up, this is unsightly and the result of the notorious penge tagger oops!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Lane, Penge, London

item.title: Empty tree pit outside 100 Hayes Chase, 24th June

item.title: Basketball hoop nets missing, 24th June
item.description:
Hi, I've started to play basketball with my son on the basketball courts in Beckenham Rec park and noticed one of the nets missing and the other unclipped from the rim. Can you replace the existing type of nets with metal nets that are more resilient and less prone to being damaged? Not having a net when playing basketball spoils the fun of the game. Appreciate kids may damage the existing net/s if replaced with nylon ones. Thank you Regards, Mark Mortlock
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Way, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large tree that needs to be cut back, 24th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park Avenue, Eden Park, London

item.title: Sinking, uneven pavement, hazard, 24th June
item.description:
